<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Positions

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Searches for an empty position around specified position. The search starts looking for an empty position at a minimum distance of [radius] from the [center] and looks as far away as [radius + maxDistance]. If a [vehicleType] parameter is specified, then the search will look for an empty positions that is big enough to hold that vehicle type. If an empty position isn't found, an empty array is returned. This command ignores moving objects present within search area. The search area could be preloaded with [[findEmptyPositionReady]] command. See also: [[BIS_fnc_findSafePos]].

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> center '''findEmptyPosition''' [radius, maxDistance, vehicleType]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> center: [[Array]] - Search area center position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z] in which case z is ignored. Accepts [[Position2D]] or [[Position3D]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [radius, maxDistance, vehicleType]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> radius: [[Number]] - Start searching no closer than <tt>radius</tt> from the center

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> maxDistance: [[Number]] - Stop searching no further than <tt>radius + maxDistance</tt> from the center

</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> vehicleType: (optional): [[String]] - Class name of a vehicle to accommodate

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - A suitable empty position in format [[Position3D]] or [] if not found

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_position = ([[getPosATL]] [[player]]) [[findEmptyPosition]] [0,100];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_position = _center [[findEmptyPosition]] [10,100,"UH60M_EP1"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Check if exact position is empty:
<code>_position = _center [[findEmptyPosition]] [0,0,"B_Boat_Armed_01_minigun_F"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[findEmptyPositionReady]], [[selectBestPlaces]], [[isFlatEmpty]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on November 6, 2013</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Keep search radius short and sweet, under 50 metres maybe. Searching big area takes long time and will result in your game stop responding until the search is over. [[isFlatEmpty]] is probably more suitable for a larger area search.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 6, 2012</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:old_man_auz|old_man_auz]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
I think the '''radius''' parameter should be treated as a 'minimum distance' from the '''centre''' position. I found that the parameter name '''radius''' was not very clear. Also, if '''radius''' is greater than '''max distance''' then the function will always return an empty array.

Here is an snippet of code I use to find a safe landing zone for an extraction helicopter. It may be useful for someone.
<code>_centre = [ getMarkerPos "marker" , random 150 , random 360 ] call BIS_fnc_relPos;
_extraction_point = [];
_max_distance = 100;
while{ count _extraction_point < 1 } do
{
	_extraction_point = _centre findEmptyPosition[ 30 , _max_distance , "UH60M_EP1" ];
	_max_distance = _max_distance + 50;
};
</code>
In the above example, make sure that "_max_distance" is greater than 30, otherwise the while loop will go forever.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
